active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the context of rising remote and hybrid work trends, discuss how endpoint DLP agents address gaps in traditional network DLP. Provide real-world examples of data breaches that could have been prevented by endpoint agents and debate potential privacy trade-offs.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

Generate 50 high-quality Anki-style flashcards optimized for spaced repetition, covering all Bloom's levels via these learning objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives ARRAY HERE]. Incorporate scaffolding layers progressively: [INSERT scaffolding_layers ARRAY HERE]. Ensure completeness: Cover types (EPP-integrated, standalone, EDR, cloud-managed), data states (use/motion/rest), actions, comparisons, remote work context, and concept map elements. Draw from research: Agents monitor endpoints (laptops/phones) for sensitive data (PII/PHI), prevent exfiltration. Embed active learning: 10% flashcards as scenario prompts linking to discussion/peer-teach/problem-solving [INSERT active_learning OBJECT HERE]. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"front": "Question", "back": {"answer": "...", "explanation": "...", "distractors": ["d1", "d2", "d3"], "hints": "...", "source": "Layer X / Objective Y"}}. Follow flashcard_schema strictly [INSERT flashcard_schema OBJECT HERE]. Balance: 20% remember/understand, 30% apply/analyze, 30% evaluate/create, 20% integration. Vary formats (cloze/MCQ/short). No duplicates; ensure pedagogical depth for university-level mastery.
